description: Michael Conlan will make his return to the ring against India's Asad Asif Khan on a 7 March bill in Brighton when his fellow Belfast man Tyrone McKenna will take on Harlem Eubank.
title: Michael Conlan: Belfast boxer confirms comeback fight against Kahn in March
title_page: Michael Conlan: Belfast boxer confirms comeback fight against Kahn in March - BBC Sport
maintext:
Michael Conlan will make his return to the ring against India's Asad Asif Khan on a 7 March bill in Brighton when his fellow Belfast man Tyrone McKenna takes on Harlem Eubank.
The 33-year-old who has not fought since being knocked out in seven rounds by England's Jordan Gill in December 2023, this week signed a deal with the Wasserman Boxing agency headed by well-known promoter Kalle Sauerland as he attempts to maintain his world title ambitions.
His defeat to Gill came after world title losses against Leigh Wood and Luis Alberto Lopez.
"I still firmly believe I have the ability to get to the very top, and I did not want to retire and 10 or 15 years down the line thinking 'what if?'," said Conlan.
"For this defining period in my career, it was vital to partner with the right promoter and I am thrilled to team up with Kalle, [his brother] Nisse and the whole team at Wasserman Boxing."
